clients.name: Client
clients.description: The HTTP client provides functionality to connect to remote HTTP services and perform requests using standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.

functions.name: init
functions.description: The HTTP client provides functionality to connect to remote HTTP services and perform requests using standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the target service

parameters.name: httpVersion
parameters.description: HTTP protocol version supported by the client

parameters.name: http1Settings
parameters.description: HTTP/1.x specific settings

parameters.name: http2Settings
parameters.description: HTTP/2 specific settings

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Maximum time(in seconds) to wait for a response before the request times out

parameters.name: forwarded
parameters.description: The choice of setting `Forwarded`/`X-Forwarded-For` header, when acting as a proxy

parameters.name: followRedirects
parameters.description: HTTP redirect handling configurations (with 3xx status codes)

parameters.name: poolConfig
parameters.description: Configurations associated with the request connection pool

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: HTTP response caching related configurations

parameters.name: compression
parameters.description: Enable request/response compression (using `accept-encoding` header)

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: Client authentication options (Basic, Bearer token, OAuth, etc.)

parameters.name: circuitBreaker
parameters.description: Circuit breaker configurations to prevent cascading failures

parameters.name: retryConfig
parameters.description: Automatic retry settings for failed requests

parameters.name: cookieConfig
parameters.description: Cookie handling settings for session management

parameters.name: responseLimits
parameters.description: Limits for response size and headers (to prevent memory issues)

parameters.name: proxy
parameters.description: Proxy server settings if requests need to go through a proxy

parameters.name: validation
parameters.description: Enable automatic payload validation for request/response data against constraints

parameters.name: socketConfig
parameters.description: Low-level socket settings (timeouts, buffer sizes, etc.)

parameters.name: laxDataBinding
parameters.description:
Enable relaxed data binding on the client side.
When enabled:
- `null` values in JSON are allowed to be mapped to optional fields
- missing fields in JSON are allowed to be mapped as `null` values

parameters.name: secureSocket
parameters.description: SSL/TLS security settings for HTTPS connections

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the `client`

functions.name: submit
functions.description: Send an asynchronous HTTP request that does not wait for the response immediately. Can be used for non-blocking operations.

parameters.name: httpVerb
parameters.description:
The HTTP verb value. The HTTP verb is case-sensitive. Use the `http:Method` type to specify the
the standard HTTP methods.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

functions.name: getResponse
functions.description: Get the response from a previously submitted asynchronous request. Can be used after calling `submit()` action to retrieve the actual response.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

functions.name: hasPromise
functions.description: Check if the server has sent a push promise for additional resources. Should be used with HTTP/2 server push functionality.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` relates to a previous asynchronous invocation

functions.name: getNextPromise
functions.description: Get the next server push promise that contains information about additional resources the server wants to send.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

functions.name: getPromisedResponse
functions.description: Get the actual response data from a server push promise. Can be used to receive resources that the server proactively sends.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The related `http:PushPromise`

functions.name: rejectPromise
functions.description: Reject a server push promise to decline receiving the additional resource.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The Push Promise to be rejected

functions.name: getCookieStore
functions.description: Get the cookie storage associated with this HTTP client. Can be used to access stored cookies for session management.

functions.name: circuitBreakerForceClose
functions.description:
Force the circuit breaker to allow all requests through, ignoring current error rates. Can be used to manually
restore service after fixing issues.

functions.name: circuitBreakerForceOpen
functions.description:
Force the circuit breaker to block all requests until the reset time expires. Can be used to manually stop
requests during maintenance or known issues.

functions.name: getCircuitBreakerCurrentState
functions.description: Check the current state of the circuit breaker. Can be used to monitor the health status of your HTTP connections.

functions.description:
Gets the hostname from the remote address. This method may trigger a DNS reverse lookup if the address was created
with a literal IP address.
```ballerina
string? remoteHost = caller.getRemoteHostName();
```

clients.name: StatusCodeClient
clients.description:
The HTTP status code client provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote HTTP service. The API it
provides includes the functions for the standard HTTP methods forwarding a received request and sending requests
using custom HTTP verbs. The responses can be binded to `http:StatusCodeResponse` types

provides includes the functions for the standard HTTP methods forwarding a received request and sending requests
using custom HTTP verbs. The responses can be binded to `http:StatusCodeResponse` types

functions.name: submit
functions.description:
Submits an HTTP request to a service with the specified HTTP verb.
The `Client->submit()` function does not give out a `http:Response` as the result.
Rather it returns an `http:HttpFuture` which can be used to do further interactions with the endpoint.

parameters.name: httpVerb
parameters.description:
The HTTP verb value. The HTTP verb is case-sensitive. Use the `http:Method` type to specify the
the standard HTTP methods.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

functions.name: getDefaultListener
functions.description:
Returns the default HTTP listener. If the default listener is not already created, a new
listener will be created with the port and configuration. An error will be returned if
the listener creation fails.

The default listener configuration can be changed in the `Config.toml` file. Example:
```toml
[ballerina.http]
defaultListenerPort = 8080
[ballerina.http.defaultListenerConfig]
httpVersion = "1.1"
[ballerina.http.defaultListenerConfig.secureSocket.key]
path = "resources/certs/key.pem"
password = "password"
```

functions.description: Creates an HTTP client capable of securing HTTP requests with authentication.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Client endpoint configurations

typeDefs.name: AUTH_HEADER
typeDefs.description: Represents the Authorization header name.

typeDefs.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BASIC
typeDefs.description: The prefix used to denote the Basic authentication scheme.

typeDefs.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BEARER
typeDefs.description: The prefix used to denote the Bearer authentication scheme.

typeDefs.name: NO_CACHE
typeDefs.description: Forces the cache to validate a cached response with the origin server before serving.

typeDefs.name: NO_STORE
typeDefs.description: Instructs the cache to not store a response in non-volatile storage.

typeDefs.name: NO_TRANSFORM
typeDefs.description: Instructs intermediaries not to transform the payload.

typeDefs.name: MAX_AGE
typeDefs.description:
When used in requests, `max-age` implies that clients are not willing to accept responses whose age is greater
than `max-age`. When used in responses, the response is to be considered stale after the specified
number of seconds.

typeDefs.name: MAX_STALE
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that the client is willing to accept responses which have exceeded their freshness lifetime by no more
than the specified number of seconds.

typeDefs.name: MIN_FRESH
typeDefs.description: Indicates that the client is only accepting responses whose freshness lifetime >= current age + min-fresh.

typeDefs.name: ONLY_IF_CACHED
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that the client is only willing to accept a cached response. A cached response is served subject to
other constraints posed by the request.

typeDefs.name: MUST_REVALIDATE
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that once the response has become stale, it should not be reused for subsequent requests without
validating with the origin server.

typeDefs.name: PUBLIC
typeDefs.description: Indicates that any cache may store the response.

typeDefs.name: PRIVATE
typeDefs.description: Indicates that the response is intended for a single user and should not be stored by shared caches.

typeDefs.name: PROXY_REVALIDATE
typeDefs.description: Has the same semantics as `must-revalidate`, except that this does not apply to private caches.

typeDefs.name: S_MAX_AGE
typeDefs.description: In shared caches, `s-maxage` overrides the `max-age` or `expires` header field.

typeDefs.name: MAX_STALE_ANY_AGE
typeDefs.description: Setting this as the `max-stale` directives indicates that the `max-stale` directive does not specify a limit.

typeDefs.name: CACHE_CONTROL_AND_VALIDATORS
typeDefs.description:
This is a more restricted mode of RFC 7234. Setting this as the caching policy restricts caching to instances
where the `cache-control` header and either the `etag` or `last-modified` header are present.

typeDefs.name: RFC_7234
typeDefs.description: Caching behaviour is as specified by the RFC 7234 specification.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_MULTIPLE_CHOICES_300
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `300 - Multiple Choices`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_MOVED_PERMANENTLY_301
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `301 - Moved Permanently`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_FOUND_302
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `302 - Found`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_SEE_OTHER_303
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `303 - See Other`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_NOT_MODIFIED_304
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `304 - Not Modified`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_USE_PROXY_305
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `305 - Use Proxy`.

typeDefs.name: REDIRECT_TEMPORARY_REDIRECT_307
typeDefs.description: Represents the HTTP redirect status code `307 - Temporary Redirect`.

typeDefs.name: IF_MODIFIED_SINCE
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `if-modified-since`. Used when validating (with the origin server) whether a cached response
is still valid. If the representation of the resource has modified since the timestamp in this field, a
304 response is returned.

typeDefs.name: IF_NONE_MATCH
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `if-none-match`. Used when validating (with the origin server) whether a cached response is
still valid. If the ETag provided in this field matches the representation of the requested resource, a
304 response is returned.

typeDefs.name: LOCATION

typeDefs.name: PRAGMA

typeDefs.name: PROXY_AUTHORIZATION

typeDefs.name: SERVER

typeDefs.name: WARNING
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `warning`. Specifies warnings generated when serving stale responses from HTTP caches.

typeDefs.name: TRANSFER_ENCODING
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `transfer-encoding`. Specifies what type of transformation has been applied to entity body.

typeDefs.name: CONNECTION
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `connection`. Allows the sender to specify options that are desired for that particular connection.

typeDefs.name: UPGRADE
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `upgrade`. Allows the client to specify what additional communication protocols it supports and
would like to use, if the server finds it appropriate to switch protocols.

typeDefs.name: CB_OPEN_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the open state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `OPEN` state, requests will fail
immediately.

typeDefs.name: CB_HALF_OPEN_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the half-open state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `HALF_OPEN` state, a trial request
will be sent to the upstream service. If it fails, the circuit will trip again and move to the `OPEN` state. If not,
it will move to the `CLOSED` state.

typeDefs.name: CB_CLOSED_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the closed state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `CLOSED` state, all requests will be
allowed to go through to the upstream service. If the failures exceed the configured threhold values, the circuit
will trip and move to the `OPEN` state.

typeDefs.name: Compression
typeDefs.description:
Options to compress using gzip or deflate.

`AUTO`: When service behaves as a HTTP gateway inbound request/response accept-encoding option is set as the
outbound request/response accept-encoding/content-encoding option
`ALWAYS`: Always set accept-encoding/content-encoding in outbound request/response
`NEVER`: Never set accept-encoding/content-encoding header in outbound request/response

typeDefs.name: Chunking
typeDefs.description:
Defines the possible values for the chunking configuration in HTTP services and clients.

`AUTO`: If the payload is less than 8KB, content-length header is set in the outbound request/response,
otherwise chunking header is set in the outbound request/response
`ALWAYS`: Always set chunking header in the response
`NEVER`: Never set the chunking header even if the payload is larger than 8KB in the outbound request/response

functions.name: getHeader
functions.description:
Returns the value of the specified header. If the specified header key maps to multiple values, the first of
these values is returned.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: addHeader
functions.description:
Adds the specified header to the response. Existing header values are not replaced, except for the `Content-Type`
header. In the case of the `Content-Type` header, the existing value is replaced with the specified value.
. Panic if an illegal header is passed.

parameters.name: headerName

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:

the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

parameters.name: headerName

parameters.name: position

Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: setHeader
functions.description:
Sets the specified header to the response. If a mapping already exists for the specified header key, the
existing header value is replaced with the specified header value. Panic if an illegal header is passed.

functions.name: getHeaderNames

functions.name: setContentType
functions.description: Sets the `content-type` header to the response.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content type value to be set as the `content-type` header

functions.name: getContentType
functions.description: Gets the type of the payload of the response (i.e., the `content-type` header value).

functions.name: getJsonPayload
functions.description:
Extract `json` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not JSON, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.name: getXmlPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `xml` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not XML, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.name: getTextPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `text` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not of type text, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.name: getByteStream
functions.description:
Gets the response payload as  a stream of byte[], except in the case of multiparts. To retrieve multiparts, use
`Response.getBodyParts()`.

parameters.name: arraySize
parameters.description: A defaultable parameter to state the size of the byte array. Default size is 8KB

functions.name: getBinaryPayload
functions.description: Gets the response payload as a `byte[]`.

functions.name: getSseEventStream
functions.description: Gets the response payload as a `stream` of SseEvent.

functions.name: getBodyParts
functions.description: Extracts body parts from the response. If the content type is not a composite media type, an error is returned.

functions.name: setETag
functions.description: Sets the `etag` header for the given payload. The ETag is generated using a CRC32 hash isolated function.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The payload for which the ETag should be set

functions.name: setLastModified
functions.description: Sets the current time as the `last-modified` header.

functions.name: setJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `json` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setAnydataAsJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `anydata` payaload, as a `json` payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setXmlPayload
functions.description:
Sets an `xml` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/xml`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `xml` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/xml` is the default value

functions.name: setTextPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `string` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set
content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `text/plain`. Any
existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `string` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `text/plain` is the default value

functions.name: setBinaryPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `byte[]` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type
can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `byte[]` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setBodyParts
functions.description:
Set multiparts as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method
set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `multipart/form-data`.
Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: bodyParts
parameters.description: The entities which make up the message body

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the top level message. This is an optional parameter.
The `multipart/form-data` is the default value

functions.name: setFileAsPayload
functions.description:
Sets the content of the specified file as the entity body of the response. If the content-type header
is not set then this method set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is
`application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the file to be set as the payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the specified file. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setByteStream
functions.description:
Sets a `Stream` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can
be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream, which needs to be set to the response

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setSseEventStream
functions.description:
Sets an `http:SseEvent` stream as the payload, along with the Content-Type and Cache-Control 
headers set to 'text/event-stream' and 'no-cache', respectively.

parameters.name: eventStream
parameters.description: SseEvent stream, which needs to be set to the response

functions.name: setPayload
functions.description:
Sets the response payload. This method overrides any existing content-type by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter. If the content type parameter is not provided then the default value derived
from the payload will be used as content-type only when there are no existing content-type header. If
the payload is non-json typed value then the value is converted to json using the `toJson` method.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
Payload can be of type `string`, `xml`, `byte[]`, `json`, `stream<byte[], io:Error?>`,
stream<SseEvent, error?>(represents Server-Sent events), `Entity[]` (i.e., a set of body
parts) or any other value of type `anydata` which will be converted to `json` using the
`toJson` method.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter

functions.name: addCookie
functions.description: Adds the cookie to response.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: The cookie, which is added to response

functions.name: removeCookiesFromRemoteStore
functions.description: Deletes the cookies in the client's cookie store.

parameters.name: cookiesToRemove
parameters.description: Cookies to be deleted

functions.name: getCookies
functions.description: Gets cookies from the response.

functions.description: Gets the status code response record from the response.

functions.name: getJsonPayload
functions.description:
Extract `json` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not JSON, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.name: getXmlPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `xml` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not XML, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.name: getTextPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `text` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not of type text, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

functions.description:
Gets the request payload as  a stream of byte[], except in the case of multiparts. To retrieve multiparts, use

Extracts body parts from the request. If the content type is not a composite media type, an error

functions.name: setJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `json` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter. If the given payload is a record type with 
the `@jsondata:Name` annotation, the `jsondata:toJson` function internally converts the record to JSON

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setXmlPayload
functions.description:
Sets an `xml` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/xml`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `xml` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/xml` is the default value

functions.name: setTextPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `string` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set
content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `text/plain`. Any
existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `text/plain` is the default value

functions.name: setBinaryPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `byte[]` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type
can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `byte[]` payload

parameters.name: contentType

The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.description:
Set multiparts as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method
set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `multipart/form-data`.
Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.description:
The content type of the top level message. This is an optional parameter.

functions.name: setFileAsPayload
functions.description:
Sets the content of the specified file as the entity body of the request. If the content-type header
is not set then this method set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is
`application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the specified file. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setByteStream
functions.description:
Sets a `Stream` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can
be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream, which needs to be set to the request

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setPayload
functions.description:
Sets the request payload. This method overrides any existing content-type by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter. If the content type parameter is not provided then the default value derived
from the payload will be used as content-type only when there are no existing content-type header.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
Payload can be of type `string`, `xml`, `byte[]`, `json`, `stream<byte[], io:Error?>`,
`Entity[]` (i.e., a set of body parts) or any other value of type `anydata` which will
be converted to `json` using the `toJson` method.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter

typeDefs.name: HttpOperation
typeDefs.description:
Defines the HTTP operations related to circuit breaker, failover and load balancer.

`FORWARD`: Forward the specified payload
`GET`: Request a resource
`POST`: Create a new resource
`DELETE`: Deletes the specified resource
`OPTIONS`: Request communication options available
`PUT`: Replace the target resource
`PATCH`: Apply partial modification to the resource
`HEAD`: Identical to `GET` but no resource body should be returned
`SUBMIT`: Submits a http request and returns an HttpFuture object
`NONE`: No operation should be performed

typeDefs.name: FailoverClientConfiguration
typeDefs.description:
Provides a set of HTTP related configurations and failover related configurations.
The following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the failover client-specific
configs.

fields.name: targets
fields.description: The upstream HTTP endpoints among which the incoming HTTP traffic load should be sent on failover

fields.name: failoverCodes
fields.description: Array of HTTP response status codes for which the failover behaviour should be triggered

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Failover delay interval in seconds

typeDefs.name: CircuitState
typeDefs.description:
A finite type for modeling the states of the Circuit Breaker. The Circuit Breaker starts in the `CLOSED` state.
If any failure thresholds are exceeded during execution, the circuit trips and goes to the `OPEN` state. After
the specified timeout period expires, the circuit goes to the `HALF_OPEN` state. If the trial request sent while
in the `HALF_OPEN` state succeeds, the circuit goes back to the `CLOSED` state.

typeDefs.name: CircuitHealth
typeDefs.description: Maintains the health of the Circuit Breaker.

fields.name: lastRequestSuccess
fields.description: Whether last request is success or not

fields.name: totalRequestCount
fields.description: Total request count received within the `RollingWindow`

fields.name: lastUsedBucketId
fields.description: ID of the last bucket used in Circuit Breaker calculations

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Circuit Breaker start time

fields.name: lastRequestTime
fields.description: The time that the last request received

fields.name: lastErrorTime
fields.description: The time that the last error occurred

fields.name: lastForcedOpenTime
fields.description: The time that circuit forcefully opened at last

fields.name: totalBuckets
fields.description: The discrete time buckets into which the time window is divided

expectedLibraries.name: ballerina/io
expectedLibraries.description: This module provides file read/write APIs and console print/read APIs. The file APIs allow read and write operations on different kinds of file types such as bytes, text, CSV, JSON, and XML. Further, these file APIs can be categorized as streaming and non-streaming APIs.

functions.name: fileReadBytes
functions.description:
Read the entire file content as a byte array.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error content = io:fileReadBytes("./resources/myfile.txt");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

functions.name: fileReadBlocksAsStream
functions.description:
Read the entire file content as a stream of blocks.
```ballerina
stream<io:Block, io:Error?>|io:Error content = io:fileReadBlocksAsStream("./resources/myfile.txt", 1000);
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: An optional size of the byte block. The default size is 4KB

functions.name: fileWriteBytes

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Byte content to write

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: To indicate whether to overwrite or append the given content

functions.name: fileWriteBlocksFromStream

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream to write

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: To indicate whether to overwrite or append the given content

functions.name: fileReadCsv

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: skipHeaders
parameters.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped prior to reading records

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description: The type of the return value (string[] or a Ballerina record)

functions.name: fileReadCsvAsStream
functions.description:
Read file content as a CSV.
When the expected data type is stream<record, io:Error?>,
the first entry of the csv file should contain matching headers.
```ballerina
stream<string[]|io:Error content = io:fileReadCsvAsStream("./resources/myfile.csv");
stream<record{}, io:Error?>|io:Error content = io:fileReadCsvAsStream("./resources/myfile.csv");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.description: The type of the return value (string[] or a Ballerina record)

parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: A CSV record stream to be written

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: To indicate whether to overwrite or append the given content

functions.name: fileReadString
functions.description:
Reads the entire file content as a `string`.
The resulting string output does not contain the terminal carriage (e.g., `\r` or `\n`).
```ballerina

```

parameters.name: path

functions.name: fileReadLines
functions.description:
Reads the entire file content as a list of lines.
The resulting string array does not contain the terminal carriage (e.g., `\r` or `\n`).


parameters.name: path

typeDefs.name: DEFAULT
typeDefs.description: The default value is the format specified by the CSVChannel. Precedence will be given to the field separator and record separator.

typeDefs.name: CSV
typeDefs.description: Field separator will be "," and the record separator will be a new line.

typeDefs.name: TDF
typeDefs.description: Field separator will be a tab and the record separator will be a new line.

typeDefs.name: COMMA
typeDefs.description: Comma (,) will be used as the field separator.

typeDefs.name: TAB
typeDefs.description: Tab (/t) will be use as the field separator.

typeDefs.name: COLON
typeDefs.description: Colon (:) will be use as the field separator.

typeDefs.name: NEW_LINE
typeDefs.description: New line character.

typeDefs.name: DEFAULT_ENCODING
typeDefs.description: Default encoding for the abstract read/write APIs.

typeDefs.name: stdout
typeDefs.description: Represents the standard output stream.

typeDefs.name: stderr
typeDefs.description: Represents the standard error stream.

typeDefs.name: CSV_RECORD_SEPARATOR
typeDefs.description: Represents the record separator of the CSV file.

typeDefs.name: FS_COLON
typeDefs.description: Represents the colon separator, which should be used to identify colon-separated files.

typeDefs.name: MINIMUM_HEADER_COUNT
typeDefs.description: Represents the minimum number of headers, which will be included in the CSV.

typeDefs.name: BIG_ENDIAN
typeDefs.description: Specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first.

typeDefs.name: LITTLE_ENDIAN
typeDefs.description: Specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first.

typeDefs.name: Block
typeDefs.description: The read-only byte array that is used to read the byte content from the streams.

typeDefs.name: ReadableByteChannel
typeDefs.description: Adding default init function to prevent object getting initialized from the user code.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Adding default init function to prevent object getting initialized from the user code.

functions.name: read
functions.description:
Source bytes from a given input resource.
This operation will be asynchronous in which the total number of required bytes might not be returned at a given
time. An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.read(1000);
```

parameters.name: nBytes
parameters.description: A positive integer. Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

functions.name: readAll
functions.description:
Read all content of the channel as a `byte` array and return a read only `byte` array.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.readAll();
```

functions.name: blockStream
functions.description:
Return a block stream that can be used to read all `byte` blocks as a stream.
```ballerina
stream<io:Block, io:Error>|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.blockStream();
```

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: A positive integer. Size of the block.

functions.name: base64Encode
functions.description:
Encodes a given `io:ReadableByteChannel` using the Base64 encoding scheme.
```ballerina
io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Encode();
```

functions.name: base64Decode
functions.description:
Decodes a given Base64 encoded `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
```ballerina
io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Decode();
```

functions.name: close
functions.description:
Closes the `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
io:Error? err = readableByteChannel.close();
```

typeDefs.name: ReadableCharacterChannel
typeDefs.description: Constructs an `io:ReadableCharacterChannel` from a given `io:ReadableByteChannel` and `Charset`.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Constructs an `io:ReadableCharacterChannel` from a given `io:ReadableByteChannel` and `Charset`.

parameters.name: byteChannel
parameters.description: The `io:ReadableByteChannel`, which would be used to read the characters

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The character set, which is used to encode/decode the given bytes to characters

functions.name: read
functions.description:
Reads a given number of characters. This will attempt to read up to the `numberOfChars` characters of the channel.
An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.
```ballerina
string|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.read(1000);
```

parameters.name: numberOfChars
parameters.description: Number of characters, which should be read

functions.name: readString
functions.description:
Read the entire channel content as a string.
```ballerina
string|io:Error content = readableCharChannel.readString();
```

typeDefs.name: Format
typeDefs.description:
The format, which will be used to represent the CSV.

DEFAULT - The default value is the format specified by the CSVChannel. Precedence will be given to the field
separator and record separator.

CSV - Field separator will be "," and the record separator will be a new line.

TDF - Field separator will be a tab and the record separator will be a new line.

typeDefs.name: Separator
typeDefs.description:
Field separators, which are supported by the `DelimitedTextRecordChannel`.

COMMA - Delimited text records will be separated using a comma

TAB - Delimited text records will be separated using a tab

COLON - Delimited text records will be separated using a colon(:)

typeDefs.name: Error
typeDefs.description: Represents IO module related errors.

typeDefs.name: ConnectionTimedOutError
typeDefs.description: This will return when connection timed out happen when try to connect to a remote host.

typeDefs.name: GenericError
typeDefs.description: Represents generic IO error. The detail record contains the information related to the error.

typeDefs.name: AccessDeniedError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned due to file permission issues.

typeDefs.name: FileNotFoundError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if the file is not available in the given file path.

typeDefs.name: TypeMismatchError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned when there is an mismatch of given type and the expected type.

typeDefs.name: EofError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if read operations are performed on a channel after it closed.

typeDefs.name: ConfigurationError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if there is an invalid configuration.

typeDefs.name: FileWriteOption
typeDefs.description: Represents a file opening options for writing.

typeDefs.name: XmlEntityType
typeDefs.description: Represents the XML entity type that needs to be written.

typeDefs.name: XmlDoctype
typeDefs.description: Represents the XML DOCTYPE entity.

typeDefs.name: XmlWriteOptions
typeDefs.description: The writing options of an XML.

typeDefs.name: PrintableRawTemplate
typeDefs.description:
Represents raw templates.
e.g: `The respective int value is ${val}`

typeDefs.name: Printable
typeDefs.description:
Defines all the printable types.
1. any typed value
2. errors
3. `io:PrintableRawTemplate` - an raw templated value

typeDefs.name: FileOutputStream
typeDefs.description:
Defines the output streaming types.
1. `stdout` - standard output stream
2. `stderr` - standard error stream

typeDefs.name: ByteOrder
typeDefs.description:
Represents network byte order.

BIG_ENDIAN - specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first.

LITTLE_ENDIAN - specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first.
